comment.author: 60302515@N05
comment._content:
Location: Botswana
In 1875, Khama III became king of the Bamangwato when he expelled his father and brother, Sekgoma and Kgamane.  He was a devout Christian and T-total and he tried banning alcohol which didn't make him too popular with his people.  His grandson, Sir Seretse Khama, had a similarly shaky start when he married a white woman but too recovered to become Botswana's first president when the British Protectorate of Bechuanaland became Botswana.
